title: Roma‚ÄìCondesa: where the city sets trends
description: Colonia Roma is globally known for being the setting of the Oscar-winning film Roma, but its fame goes far beyond that: here, history, culture, and modernity coexist on every street. With more than 1,500 historic buildings beautifying the area, this tour invites you to discover how these neighborhoods became the cultural, architectural, and social center of the capital. You will stroll through squares and avenues surrounded by imposing constructions in art deco, neo-gothic, and eclectic styles, which blend with modern cafes, art galleries, and hidden bookstores.Every corner has a story to tell, from urban legends to anecdotes of artists, writers, and intellectuals who once walked here. Roma-Condesa are not just neighborhoods to explore: they are an experience to live. Among tree-lined streets, artistic cafes, impressive architecture, and a creative atmosphere, you will discover why these spaces have become favorites for both locals and travelers from all over the world. üë£

title: Taco Tour: From the Street to the Michelin Guide
description: We will start with the legendary Arab taco, the origin of the taco tradition, and continue to places with history to taste everything from the juiciest trompo al pastor to the smoked cochinita pibil, a delicacy that makes Mexicans proud and delighted. During the tour, we will visit a taqueria recommended by the Michelin Guide and featured in a Netflix gastronomic documentary, a true gastronomic pride that has conquered palates all over the world. Each visit will be an opportunity to learn anecdotes about the taco tradition, discover ancestral techniques, and appreciate why these places are true culinary treasures. More than just a tour, it's an immersion in the local culture that combines history, flavor, and hospitality. Come ready to explore, learn, and enjoy this tour that will win your heart and your appetite, taco by taco. üë£ -Food consumption is not included, IT IS VERY IMPORTANT TO CONSIDER BRINGING AT LEAST 300 MEXICAN PESOS PER PERSON FOR YOUR CONSUMPTION. -There is no vegan option during the tour. -All types of meat are consumed during the tour.

title: Free Tour CDMX, Av "El Paseo de la Reforma"
description:
Hello and welcome to CDMX! We are Vale and Jona, we will be your guides on this exciting and mysterious tour along the most emblematic avenue in the city. Places we will visit on the tour: We begin the tour at the sculpture of Tlaloc next to the Anthropology Museum on Avenida Reforma, where I will briefly tell you about Pre-Hispanic History, we will walk through a part of Chapultepec Forest, where we will find archaeological remains and finally we will visit the most important part of Avenida Reforma to learn the details of its buildings and monuments. Content rich tour with City native Valeria this afternoon in perfect walking weather!  She‚Äôs very knowledgeable about the City‚Äôs history and peppers her remarks at each stop with local legends and back stories.  Very personable guide and went longer to make sure she had covered all of the spots when I missed the  starting point and turned out to be the only one. Pointed out items in the Park I know would have otherwise missed, and shared many illustrative photos on her tablet.  Even provided a restroom stop and coin to enter! 
Highly recommend the tour and especially Valeria!
duration: Free Tour CDMX, Av "El Paseo de la Reforma"5.00(2)3 hoursJona&Vale ToursPay what you wishFree Tour

title: Coyoac√°n neighborhood and Frida Kahlo üé®
description: We will start our tour in the blue house of Frida Kahlo and we will talk about her life and importance in society. We will walk through one of the oldest and most beautiful neighborhoods in the city. Taste Mexican gastronomy while learning about the history of some artists and the volcanic origin of this land. We will go to alleys and places that only locals know about, you will see urban art and you will understand the importance of murals in Mexico City. We will visit the Plaza de Santa Catarina and we will tell about the religious conquest and evangelization. We will visit the Reyes Heroles House of Culture and the archaeological pieces that are hidden inside. Meeting point: Ignacio Allende 140, Del Carmen, Coyoac√°n, 04100 Mexico City, CDMX, Mexico Find us with umbrella and GREEN shirt We are waiting for you! El tour ha sido m√°gico. Nos ha encantado todo lo que nos ha contado Tom√°s, el recorrido y el buen rollo. Sin duda lo recomendariamos a todo el mundo que visite CDMX.
